parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number.  While the absence of a CMF number doesn't automatically exclude it from being electoral propaganda, it suggests it might not be directly linked to an officially registered campaign.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post mentions "Manolache Vasile Senator" in the hashtags.  This clearly refers to a specific candidate, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The hashtags further suggest an attempt to broaden reach. This satisfies Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's call to action ("Pe 1 decembrie, hai să votăm pentru lideri care să pună sănătatea pe primul loc...") directly encourages voters to support candidates prioritizing healthcare improvements.  The hashtags reinforce this objective. This strongly suggests an electoral objective, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - c. The content aims to positively influence voters towards Manolache Vasile.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post's content, while touching upon a relevant societal issue (healthcare), lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting. It presents a biased perspective advocating for a specific candidate's approach to healthcare reform. It does not qualify as journalism.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post does not express a personal opinion; instead, it promotes a political agenda and a specific candidate. The language used is persuasive and promotional, not reflective of a personal viewpoint.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>946591617530257</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by Momentum Motion Pictures SRL, promotes Manolache Vasile, a senatorial candidate.  The post directly encourages voters to support candidates who prioritize healthcare improvements, linking this to Manolache Vasile.  The call to action ("Pe 1 decembrie, hai să votăm...") and the hashtags clearly aim to influence the vote in his favor. While the post addresses a legitimate societal concern, its biased presentation and clear intention to sway voters constitute electoral propaganda. The post's timing (after the official campaign period) is not specified in the provided data, but if it falls outside the legal timeframe, it would further strengthen the case for a violation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Manolache Vasile</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Momentum Motion Pictures SRL</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Momentum Motion Pictures SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024 (data nefiind specificată în datele furnizate, dar presupunând că este după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie), care promovează candidatul Manolache Vasile la Senat, îndemnând direct la votul pentru candidați care prioritizează îmbunătățirea sistemului sanitar, cu un efect electoral clar pozitiv pentru Manolache Vasile.  Postarea, cu ID-ul 946591617530257, utilizează un limbaj persuasiv și conține hashtag-uri care vizează o audiență largă, îndeplinind toate criteriile pentru propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea campaniei.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
